title: As a user I want to be able to run the PIEF List Report
custom_expected:
Report Layout: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/PIEF+List+-+Report+Layout

Report Details: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/PIEF+List+-+Report+Details

Report Logic: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=118483014

Report Prompts: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/PIEF+List+-+Prompts

View Story: #153394283

Acceptance Criteria: 
* "PIEF List" is a report in the Report listing widget. Selecting this report from the widget will launch the prompts according to the requirements. 
* The category of this report should be "Pro Player Management". 
* Entering the desired prompts and running the report will work and match the requirements. 
* The report will have an LDAP associated with it. Please provide the LDAP when the story is delivered and a user id to test the report and security with.

title: As a BOC user I want to view the PIEF List widget
custom_expected:
Wireframe: 
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=pief_list_boc_widget

Acceptance Criteria: 
* As a BOC user I see a "PIEF List" tab under the "Transactions" dashboard. 
* Loading the PIEF List tab as the BOC will have the widget, per the provided wireframe. 
* All 30 Orgs will display for each year. 
*Filters covered in another story*

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to edit a PIEF List
custom_expected:
Wireframe: 
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=pief_list_-_boc

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a BOC user with edit permissions is viewing a PIEF List, regardless of if the current date is on or before the PIEF List Submission Deadline system date, then the BOC user should see an "Edit" button. 
* Clicking "Edit" will reload the screen in edit mode, per the wireframe.
* The user is able to select a Reason for the player (Extreme Fatigue, Physical Injury or Club Exemption). 
* The user is able to enter Details for the reason the player is being placed on the PIEF List. 
* The user is able to edit the Native Country field, though it should be defaulted already for them. 
* The user is able to enter a Decision for the player (Approved or Rejected).
* The user is able to enter comments via a comments bubble for their decision.  
* The user is able to delete a player's row by clicking on the trash can icon associated with the row. The trash can should only be available in edit mode, and the user needs to save changes to the form in order for the deletion to stick. 
* In edit mode, a Save button and a Cancel button are always available. 
* Clicking "Save" will save the changes made to the screen, as well as display a blue successful save notification. 
* Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to lose their changes. If they confirm, the screen reloads in view mode, with no changes stored. If they do not confirm, return the user to the form in edit mode with their changes maintained. 
*Adding and removing players is covered in other stories*

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to send an updated List to a Club
custom_expected:
Acceptance Criteria:
* BOC users with PIEF List edit permissions see a "Send List to Club" button on a Club's individual PIEF List if the PIEF List is in a Reviewed status.  
* When "Send List to Club" is clicked, the system should prompt the user to confirm that they wish to send the list to the Club. 
  - Message body should be: "Send PIEF List to <Org>?" (Example: Send PIEF List to ARI?) with OK/Cancel buttons
* If the user clicks "Cancel" then no action is taken and the user is returned to the form. 
* If the user clicks "OK", then the system should check if emails are enabled by ensuring that "Send Emails" is set to Yes. 
* If yes, then the system should generate an email to each of the email addresses listed in the e-mail utility under the corresponding Club's "PIEF List" that is checked off to receive emails, as long as the "Club Enabled" checkbox is also checked. 
* The email will match the provided template. 
  - Subject: "PIEF List"  
  - Body: "Attached is your Physical Injury or Extreme Fatigue List."

title: As a BOC User I want to be able to send the Finalized versions of the PIEF List
custom_expected:
Wireframe: 
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=pief_list_boc_widget

Acceptance Criteria:
* BOC users with PIEF List edit permissions see a "Send Lists to BOC" on the PIEF List widget. 
* When "Send Lists to BOC" is clicked, the system should prompt the user to confirm that they wish to send all Reviewed lists to the BOC. (see wire) 
* If the user clicks "Cancel" then no action is taken and the user is returned to the widget. 
* If the user clicks "OK", then the system should check if emails are enabled by ensuring that "Send Emails" is set to Yes. 
* If yes, then the system should generate an email to each of the email addresses listed in the e-mail utility under the BOC's "PIEF List" that is checked off to receive emails, as long as the "BOC Enabled" checkbox is also checked. 
* The email will match the provided template. 
  - Subject: "PIEF List"  
  - Body: "Attached is the Physical Injury or Extreme Fatigue List."

title: As a user I want to be able to Add a Player to the PIEF List
custom_expected:
Wireframe: 
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=pief_list_-_club
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=pief_list_-_boc

Acceptance Criteria: 
* As a Club user or a BOC user, when viewing a PIEF List in edit mode, there is an "Add Player" button. 
* Clicking "Add Player" will add a row to the utility. 
* The "Player" field will be a Select2 dropdown with a list of all of the corresponding Org's current players (every player that currently displays on a MJ or MN Roster). 
* The player's name will appear as Last, Roster (DOB). 
* Selecting a player from the dropdown will lock in that player, pull in their cumulative season stats information and populate the table accordingly. 
* The player's birth country will auto-populate the Native Country field, though it will remain editable. 
* The player's position and current level will be pulled from their profile.

title: As a Club user I want to submit my PIEF list to the BOC
custom_expected:
Wireframe: 
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=pief_list_-_club

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Club user is viewing their Preliminary PIEF List - if they have edit permissions and the current date is on or before the PIEF List Submission Deadline, then they see a "Submit to BOC" button in edit or view mode. 
* Clicking the Submit to BOC button will store any changes made, and run a required field check.
* Once the required field check passes, the system will: 
  - Reload the form in View mode if it was previously in Edit mode.
  - Update the form's status to "Submitted"
  - Update the "Submitted" and "Submitted By" fields with the username and date that the form was submitted. 
  - Remove the "Submit to BOC" button for the form. This button can only be used in a Preliminary state, so once it has been submitted it should no longer be visible on the form. 
* BOC users should see the information for this PIEF List updated on their widget. The new status should display, along with the number of players on the form that are pending a decision.

title: As a Club user I want to be able to edit my PIEF List
custom_expected:
Wireframe: 
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=pief_list_-_club

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Club user with edit permissions is viewing the PIEF List for their Org, if the current date is on or before the PIEF List Submission Deadline system date, then the Club user should see an "Edit" button. 
* Clicking "Edit" will reload the screen in edit mode, per the wireframe.
* The user is able to select a Reason for the player (Extreme Fatigue, Physical Injury or Club Exemption). 
* The user is able to enter Details for the reason the player is being placed on the PIEF List. 
* The user is able to edit the Native Country field, though it should be defaulted already for them. 
* They are not able to edit the Decision or its associated comments. 
* The user is able to delete a player's row by clicking on the trash can icon associated with the row. The trash can should only be available in edit mode, and the user needs to save changes to the form in order for the deletion to stick. 
* In edit mode, a Save button and a Cancel button are always available. 
* Clicking "Save" will save the changes made to the screen, as well as display a blue successful save notification. 
* Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to lose their changes. If they confirm, the screen reloads in view mode, with no changes stored. If they do not confirm, return the user to the form in edit mode with their changes maintained. 
*Adding players is covered in other stories*

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to mark a specific Club's list as Reviewed
custom_expected:
Wireframe: 
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=pief_list_-_boc

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a BOC user is viewing a Submitted PIEF List - if they have edit permissions, then they see a "Mark Reviewed" button in edit or view mode. 
* Clicking the Mark Reviewed button will store any changes made, and run a required field check (A decision must be entered for each player on the List in order to pass this required field check).
* Once the required field check passes, the system will: 
  - Reload the form in View mode if it was previously in Edit mode.
  - Update the form's status to "Reviewed"
  - Update the "Reviewed" and "Reviewed By" fields with the username and date that the form was marked reviewed. 
  - Remove the "Mark Reviewed" button for the form. This button can only be used in a Submitted state, so once it has been marked reviewed it should no longer be visible on the form. 
* BOC users should see the information for this PIEF List updated on their widget. The new status should display, along with the number of players on the form that are pending a decision.

title: PIEF List improvements
custom_expected:
'Enhancements from users

- Replace Winter League club columns and fields on the Profile with a "native country" column on the PIEF list. It should default to Birth country but it's editable to both Club and BOC to change to something else
- No need for a submission workflow. The table is editable by clubs until the PIEF List system date is reached and after that date, only editable by BOC
- Need to be clearer than ebis 1 when player is at risk of not reaching threshold. Color coding is not sufficient
- All other feedback should be revisited after winter meetings



Attached:
- Thresholds

Wire:
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/pief_list_-_club.html

title: As a Intl BOC Admin, I want to see a prior year column for each stat
custom_preconds: Wire: [https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=pief_list_-_boc|https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=pief_list_-_boc]AC:* Stat columns will feature both current year and prior year stats* The layout will match the provided wire* This includes all stats** IP** GP** PA** IC

title: As a Intl BOC Admin, I want to see if a player ended the season on the IL while reviewing the PIEF List
custom_preconds: Wire: [https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=pief_list_-_boc|https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=pief_list_-_boc]Data Discovery:[https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3789296/PIEF+List+-+Entry+Form|https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3789296/PIEF+List+-+Entry+Form]AC:* There will be a new "IL at EOS" column added to the PIEF List screen* The layout will match the provided wire and data discovery* This column will be populated with a green checkmark if the player was on the IL on the last day of the season for the Club he was assigned to** For example, if a player was on a DSL roster than ended on 8/25, and he was on the IL that day, he would have a green checkmark in this column* If the player was not on the IL on the last day of the season, this column will be blank

title: As a Intl BOC Admin, I want to see supporting columns for Plate Appearances and Innings Caught on the PIEF List
custom_preconds: Wire: [https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=pief_list_-_boc|https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=pief_list_-_boc]Data Discovery:[https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3789296/PIEF+List+-+Entry+Form|https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3789296/PIEF+List+-+Entry+Form]AC:* There will be four new columns added to the PIEF List:** yyyy LOP by Innings (prior year)** yyyy LOP by Innings (current year)** yyyy LOP by TPA (prior year)** yyyy LOP by TPA (current year)* These columns will follow the existing logic in the other LOP columns:** Calculated by the system based on the player's stats. If no stats found, set to Rookie. If stats are found more than one level of play, set to the highest level of play that the player reaches 50% of stats played for.Ex: If player played 20% of games at MJ level and 30% at AAA and 50% at AA, their LOP would be AAA becuase the 20 MJ and 30 AAA = 50%. Locks when form is moved to Reviewed status.* The columns in the widget will be rearranged to match the data discovery and wireNOTE: Please confirm we currently show Rookie when no stats are found

title: As a Intl BOC Admin, I want the Details column to be a conditional dropdown on the PIEF List
custom_preconds: Wire: [https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=pief_list_-_boc|https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=pief_list_-_boc]Data Discovery:AC:* When adding players to the PIEF List, Details will be a dropdown if either of the following values is selected as a Reason:** Physical Injury** Extreme Fatigue* If Physical Injury is selected, the Details dropdown will contain the following values:** 60 IL days / 15 in last 60 days of season** Ended season on IL** Surgery exemption* If Extreme Fatigue is selected, the Details dropdown will contain the following values:** Meets threshold** Workload increase exemption* If Club Exemption is selected, Details will remain a text box

title: PIEF List Should be Updated to ONLY include Regular Season stats from Affiliated Leagues
custom_preconds: Currently the PIEF List includes stats from the Mexican League and post season stats from affiliated leagues.It should only include regular season stats from affiliated leagues.  Users have offered to confirm the logic we use.
